alert.note: Alert for Central and Southern Lewis and Clark; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 3:44PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Lewis and Clark and southwestern Cascade Counties through 415 PM MDT... At 343 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms 14 miles west of Wolf Creek, or 35 miles northwest of Helena, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wolf Creek, Bowmans Corner and Craig. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 226 and 239. Highway 200 between mile markers 82 and 115. Highway 287 between mile markers 1 and 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
